Key Match Events: Orlando Magic limited the Knicks to 4-for-22 shooting from 3-point range and didn’t allow a make in the second half until Cam Payne’s basket with 8.2 seconds remaining.
Jalen Brunson and Mikal Bridges each scored 24 points for the Knicks.
Kentavious Caldwell-Pope added 15 points for the Magic.
Cole Anthony scored 24 points, Wendell Carter Jr. had a season-high 19 off the bench for the Magic.
The Knicks were held to their lowest point total of the season in their season-high third straight loss.
Cam Payne scored the only made basket for the Knicks in the second half with 8.2 seconds remaining.
Pre-Game Insights: Karl-Anthony Towns, averaging 25.3 points and an NBA-leading 14 rebounds, sat with right knee pain.
Post-Match Reflections: The Magic don’t let their offensive problems affect their defensive intensity, and those offensive problems should ease up once they get some bodies back.
A team that averages nearly 118 points could never sustain a good flow without Towns, as the Magic’s size forced the Knicks to use Jericho Sims, who isn’t an offensive threat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Magic avoided a four-game sweep by winning the final meeting, keeping the lead in the all-time series at 68-66.
